description: Master the art of grouping related items using ordered, unordered, and description lists.

slides.title: Unordered Lists
slides.content:
# Unordered Lists ü•£ An unordered list starts with the `
    ` tag. Each list item starts with the `
  • ` tag. The list items will be marked with bullets (small black circles) by default. ```html
    • Coffee
    • Tea
    • Milk
    ``` - Useful for items where order **doesn't matter**.

slides.title: Ordered Lists
slides.content:
# Ordered Lists üî¢ An ordered list starts with the `
    ` tag. Each list item starts with the `
  1. ` tag. The list items will be marked with numbers by default. ```html
    1. First Item
    2. Second Item
    3. Third Item
    ``` - Useful for steps, rankings, or instructions.

slides.title: Description Lists
slides.content:
# Description Lists üìñ

A description list is a list of terms, with a description of each term.

- `<dl>` defines the description list
- `<dt>` defines the term (name)
- `<dd>` describes each term

```html
<dl>
  <dt>HTML</dt>
  <dd>HyperText Markup Language</dd>
  <dt>CSS</dt>
  <dd>Cascading Style Sheets</dd>
</dl>
```

slides.title: List Item Markers
slides.content:
# Custom Markers üé® You can change the marker type using the `type` attribute (for `
    `) or CSS (for `
      `). ## Ordered List Types - `type="1"` (1, 2, 3) - Default - `type="A"` (A, B, C) - `type="a"` (a, b, c) - `type="I"` (I, II, III) - `type="i"` (i, ii, iii) ```html
      1. Phase One
      2. Phase Two
      ```

slides.title: Unordered List Styles
slides.content:
# CSS List Styles üíÖ use the `list-style-type` CSS property. ```html
  • Coffee
  • Tea
  • Coffee
  • Tea
  • Coffee
  • Tea
```

slides.title: Nested Lists
slides.content:
# Nested Lists ü™Ü Lists can be nested (li inside li). ```html
  • Coffee
  • Tea
    • Black tea
    • Green tea
  • Milk
``` > üí° **Tip:** Indent your code to make nested lists readable!

slides.title: Control Numbering
slides.content:
# Start and Reversed ‚èØÔ∏è ## Start Attribute Specifies the start value of an ordered list. ```html
  1. Fifty
  2. Fifty One
``` ## Reversed Attribute Specifies that the list order should be descending (9, 8, 7...). ```html
  1. Third
  2. Second
  3. First
```

slides.title: Lists Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: HTML Lists üéì

Organize your content effectively.

- **Ordered (`<ol>`)**: Numbered items (1, 2, 3).
- **Unordered (`<ul>`)**: Bulleted items (‚Ä¢).
- **Description (`<dl>`)**: Terms defined (`<dt>`, `<dd>`).
- **Nesting**: Lists inside lists.
- **Styling**: Remove bullets for navigation menus.
